meanings.definition: A person who sets and arranges type for printing.
meanings.sent1: The typograph carefully selected the fonts for the new book.
meanings.sent2: The typograph worked diligently to layout the text for the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The typograph joked that they were a 'font whisperer' due to their expertise.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in arranging type made her a typograph maestro.
meanings.sent5: The typograph's skill in typesetting was unmatched in the printing industry.

meanings.definition: The art or process of printing with type.
meanings.sent1: Learning typograph involves understanding different font styles.
meanings.sent2: Typograph has evolved significantly with the advancement of technology.
meanings.sent3: The museum showcased the history of typograph through interactive exhibits.
meanings.sent4: In the digital age, typograph is a blend of tradition and innovation.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of typograph lies in its ability to convey emotions through text.

meanings.definition: The style, arrangement, or appearance of printed matter.
meanings.sent1: The typograph of the magazine cover caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: Good typograph enhances the readability of a document.
meanings.sent3: The typograph of the poster was so captivating that it drew a crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her eye for typograph details made her designs stand out.
meanings.sent5: The typograph of the book cover conveyed the essence of the story within.
